schemas.purpose: JSON Schema defining type definitions and validation schemas for CodeRef Explorer Sidebar components (TreeNode, FavoriteItem, FavoriteGroup, ViewMode, ContextMenuItem, etc.)
schemas.notes: Project-specific TypeScript interface definitions for dashboard UI components. Tightly coupled to coderef-dashboard implementation. Not reusable across other projects.

schemas.purpose: JSON Schema for CodeRef Explorer page component validation - defines RouteDefinition, PageMetadata, Dependencies, PerformanceBudget for Next.js App Router pages
schemas.notes: Page-level schema specific to coderef-dashboard Next.js architecture. Defines metadata and performance budgets for a single page component. Not a reusable standard.

schemas.purpose: JSON Schema for cross-platform ProjectSelector component - validates props, state, platform support (web File System Access API vs Electron IPC), and performance budgets
schemas.notes: Cross-platform component schema with reusable validation patterns for web/Electron dual deployment. Could be useful for other cross-platform CodeRef tools that need project selection with File System Access API support. Contains performance budgets and platform compatibility definitions that could standardize similar components.

standards.purpose: Auto-generated documentation of behavior patterns discovered in coderef-dashboard - server/client component architecture, state management (Context API, Zustand, useReducer), error handling patterns, toast notifications
standards.notes: Auto-generated by docs-mcp establish_standards tool. Documents existing patterns in THIS codebase rather than prescribing standards. Project-specific inventory, not a reusable quality gate or enforcement tool.

standards.purpose: Auto-generated documentation of UI patterns - icon library (lucide-react), styling framework (Tailwind CSS), common patterns (flex-layout, gap utilities), discovered color palette
standards.notes: Auto-generated pattern discovery, not enforcement. Documents current state of UI implementation in coderef-dashboard. Color palette and styling patterns are project-specific design choices.

standards.purpose: Auto-generated documentation of UX patterns - Next.js routing (next_link, next_router), file organization (component directories), accessibility features (aria attributes)
standards.notes: Documents observed patterns in coderef-dashboard file structure and routing. Project-specific architecture documentation, not a prescriptive standard.

standards.purpose: Auto-generated inventory of all 70 components in coderef-dashboard - component names, types, status, file paths
standards.notes: Component inventory list, not a standard or validation tool. Project-specific catalog of UI components. Useful for documentation but not enforceable across projects.

agent_recommendation: Found 7 validation/standards files in coderef-dashboard. Only 1 file should move to papertrail: project-selector-schema.json contains reusable cross-platform validation patterns for web/Electron components with File System Access API support. The other 2 schemas are project-specific UI component definitions. All 4 standards files are auto-generated documentation (not enforcement tools) - they describe existing patterns rather than prescribe reusable standards. No validators or QA tools found. Recommendation: Move project-selector-schema.json to papertrail as a reusable component validation template for cross-platform CodeRef tools.
